article.title: The role of the $S_3$ GUT leptoquark in flavor universality and collider searches

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the three types of box diagrams in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The diagrams show the decay of S3 and R˜2 into τ τ bb final state.
The diagrams represent the contributions of S3 and R˜2 to ∆ms through box diagrams.
The diagrams illustrate the production of S3 and R˜2 via gluon fusion at the LHC.
The diagrams depict the LFV decay of τ → 3µ mediated by S3 and quarks.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from Figure 2 regarding the explanation of the RD(∗) anomaly?
choices: The RD(∗) anomaly can be easily resolved by considering S3 couplings to muons only.
Including the LHC constraint on ybµ significantly improves the fit to the RD(∗) anomaly.
The tension between RD(∗) and Rµ/e\nD(∗) is exacerbated when the LHC constraint on ybµ is included.
The preferred region of the parameter space perfectly aligns with the central value of the RD(∗) measurement.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 3, what is the primary reason the optimal region for the tauonic couplings (ysτ, ybτ) does not align with the central value of RD(∗)?
choices: The constraints from the b → sµµ measurements pull the preferred region away from the RD(∗) solution.
The limits from (g-2)µ disfavor large values of ysτ and ybτ, pushing the fit towards smaller values.
The constraints from Rνν and ∆ms prevent large products of ybτ ysτ, hindering a better fit to RD(∗).
The LHC limits from direct searches for S3 significantly constrain the allowed values of ysτ and ybτ.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key takeaway from the right panel of Figure 4 regarding the LHC sensitivity to third generation leptoquarks?
choices: The current LHC data with 12.9 fb−1 excludes both degenerate LQs with masses below 600 GeV regardless of βeff.
The LHC with 300 fb−1 of integrated luminosity will be sensitive to LQ masses up to 2 TeV.
The current LHC limits from LQ pair production are already sufficient to probe the 1 σ region of the flavor fit.
The LHC sensitivity to LQ pair production deteriorates at higher masses, making it less effective than high-mass τ τ searches.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main takeaway from Figure 6 regarding the high-mass τ τ production at the LHC?
choices: The presence of light S3 leads to a significant reduction in the τ τ production cross-section compared to the SM prediction.
The destructive interference between the LQ signal and the SM Drell-Yan background completely cancels out the LQ contribution to high-mass τ τ tails.
The high-mass τ τ production at the LHC is not a sensitive probe for the considered LQ model due to the limited statistics in the tail of the invariant mass distribution.
The high-luminosity LHC can probe a substantial portion of the LQ parameter space using high-mass τ τ searches, complementing the LQ pair production searches.
